meanings.definition: The total number of workers available to perform a task.
meanings.sent1: The construction site required a lot of manpower to complete the project on time.
meanings.sent2: The company's success was attributed to the dedicated manpower working diligently.
meanings.sent3: The robots joked about needing 'manpower' to lift heavy objects, pretending to be human.
meanings.sent4: In the battle of efficiency, the new technology surpassed traditional manpower in speed and accuracy.
meanings.sent5: The image of a sea of workers moving in unison showcased the true power of manpower.

meanings.definition: The labor force or workforce of a company or organization.
meanings.sent1: The manpower at the factory was skilled and efficient in their tasks.
meanings.sent2: The organization invested in training programs to enhance the skills of their manpower.
meanings.sent3: During the team-building exercise, the CEO playfully joined the manpower in a game of tug-of-war.
meanings.sent4: The manpower of the company formed the backbone of its operations, ensuring smooth functioning.
meanings.sent5: The dedication and hard work of the manpower were recognized with a special award ceremony.
